briefTitle: Comparison of Perioperative Opioid Consumption Following Pectoral Nerve Block for Breast Cancer Surgery
officialTitle: Comparison of Perioperative Opioid Consumption Following Pectoral Nerve Block Under General Anesthesia for Breast Cancer Surgery: A Randomized Clinical Trial
primaryOutcomeMeasure: Intraoperative remifentanil consumption for the first 30 minutes of surgery
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* ASA 1 to 3 inclusively
* breast cancer surgery with or without axillary dissection

Exclusion Criteria:

* any contraindication to the pectoral nerve block (coagulopathy, infection, pre- existing neuropathy, local anesthetic allergy and refusal of local anesthesia)
* refusal to participate in the study
* patient with dementia
* preoperative breast pain
* preoperative opioid consumption
* breast reconstructive surgery
* bilateral surgery
* pregnant patient
